signal_description: Retrieve the count of distinct 'Last Invoice Id' from the 'defaultview-545' table where the 'Last Invoice Payment Date' is null.
llm_output:
{
"signal_description": "Retrieve the count of distinct 'Last Invoice Id' from the 'defaultview-545' table where the 'Last Invoice Payment Date' is null."
}

This signal_description was constructed by analyzing the SIGNAL query and breaking it down into its component parts.

* The first part of the query is "SELECT count(distinct 'Last Invoice Id')", which tells us that we want to retrieve the count of distinct values in the 'Last Invoice Id' column.
* The second part of the query is "FROM 'defaultview-545'", which tells us the table name from which we want to retrieve the data.
* The third part of the query is "WHERE 'Last Invoice Payment Date' IS NULL", which tells us that we want to filter the data to only include rows where the 'Last Invoice Payment Date' column is null.

Putting all of this information together, we get the signal_description: "Retrieve the count of distinct 'Last Invoice Id' from the 'defaultview-545' table where the 'Last Invoice Payment Date' is null."

the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.

Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SELECT count(distinct "Last Invoice Id" ) FROM "defaultview-545"
WHERE 
"Last Invoice Payment Date" IS NULL
